Package org.neo4j.kernel.impl.index.schema

Class SimpleEntryStorage<ENTRY,​CURSOR>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.neo4j.kernel.impl.index.schema.SimpleEntryStorage<ENTRY,​CURSOR>
  • Type Parameters:
    ENTRY - Type of entry we are storing.
    CURSOR - Cursor type responsible for deserializing what we have stored.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    IndexKeyStorage, IndexUpdateStorage
    public abstract class SimpleEntryStorage<ENTRY,​CURSOR>
extends Object
implements Closeable
    Not thread safe, except for count() which does not support calls concurrent with add(Object). Storage that store entries in a file by simply appending them. Entries can be read back, in the order they where added, through a SimpleEntryStorage. This storage is useful when we don't want to hold all entries in memory. Extending classes are responsible for serializing and deserializing entries. On close, file will be deleted but provided ByteBufferFactory will not be closed.

      • add

        abstract void add​(ENTRY entry,
                  PageCursor pageCursor)
           throws IOException
        DON'T CALL THIS METHOD DIRECTLY. Instead, use add(Object). Write entry to pageCursor. Implementor of this method is responsible for calling prepareWrite(int) before actually start writing.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • reader

        abstract CURSOR reader​(PageCursor pageCursor)
                throws IOException
        DON'T CALL THIS METHOD DIRECTLY. Instead use reader(). Return SimpleEntryStorage responsible for deserializing wrapping provided PageCursor, pointing to head of file.
        Throws:
        IOException
